page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY TOWN COUNCIL
page.content: In North Hykeham there were two manors.Serfs and villains worked for the Lord, and they could do nothing else.Each manor had its own mill.In the 12th century one manor was given to the King of France and the other to Christ College Cambridge.Later Geoffrey of Hykeham sold part to the cathedral and some to the Priory of St.Katherine.South Hykeham used to be called Church Hykeham and North Hykeham,Chapel Hykeham.North Hykeham has 19 councillors. INSIGNIA- At the top is an eagle.The white band down the middle is the Roman Road.The oak leaves and acorns means rural Lincolnshire.At the top right hand corner there is the Katherine wheel.The oak tree stands for the Kesteven Forest.The two windmills stand for the two manors.The blue lines are the Beck and the Drain.
